definition: to examine/to check/to keep a lookout/cautious/restrained (in speech or mannerisms)
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Patty questions whether Palmer has had any past indiscretions.
sentences.chinese: 派蒂询问帕默是否在过去有过不检点的行为。

sentences.english: You may come back to work if you'll behave yourself, she says.
sentences.chinese: 她说你要是能知道检点，你仍旧可以回去上工。

sentences.english: Only don't stain it, and do behave nicely.
sentences.chinese: 只是别把它弄脏了，而且一定要言行检点。

sentences.english: Don't dare the press to catch you in an indiscretion either.
sentences.chinese: 也不要激媒体当场捕捉到你的不检点行为。

sentences.english: Life misconduct, a lot of sexual partners, there are many high-class friends.
sentences.chinese: 生活不检点，性伴侣一大堆，有许多高阶层的朋友。

sentences.english: The results of male behavior can be seen in changing patterns of infection.
sentences.chinese: 男性的不检点行为可以从病毒传染途径的变化中看出。

sentences.english: Please behave yourself before the guests.
sentences.chinese: 在宾客面前请你检点一些。
不，她们是行为检点的人。

definition: (army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
to request recognition for sb's merits/to recommend sb for promotion or an award
my husband and master (archaic)/playboy of rich family/pimp
inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
